Class Settings

java.lang.Cloneable
public abstract class Settings
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

Interface to configure ObjectManager Settings, including Fetch Policy, Access Policy, Client Cache Type, default ClassLoader.

getFetchPolicy

public abstract int getFetchPolicy()
Returns current fetch policy.

If Fetch Policy is EAGER then an always an instance of user defined POJO class is returned and all properties are immediately assigned according to database values. If any of properties refer to other persistent objects such references are followed and corresponding objects are retrieved from the database.

NB: Fetch Policy is EAGER can potentially lead to retrieving very big chunks of data from database and OutOfMemoryError.

If Fetch Policy is LAZY then an instance of a subclass exetnding user defined POJO class is returned. Its properties are only retrieved on first attempt to access the object.

Fetch Policy is LAZY is not supported for access type FIELDS. However application can call ObjectManager method swizzle() to fetch such properties. Comparison with supported values of fetch policy should be done using bitwise AND operator not "==" because of possible biwise combinations explained in documentation to setFetchPolicy(int) method.

Supported values:

  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_EAGER
  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_LAZY
  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_REFETCH_AFTER_SAVE
  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_DISCARD_AFTER_SAVE
Or a bitwise OR combination of the above:
  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_EAGER | ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_REFETCH_AFTER_SAVE
  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_LAZY | ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_REFETCH_AFTER_SAVE
  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_EAGER | ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_DISCARD_AFTER_SAVE
  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_LAZY | ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_DISCARD_AFTER_SAVE

Returns:
Currently used Fetch Policy
See Also:
setFetchPolicy(int), ObjectManager.swizzle(Object), ObjectManager.detach(Object)

setFetchPolicy

public abstract int setFetchPolicy(int fetchPolicy)
Sets Fetch Policy to use.

Supported values:

  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_EAGER
  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_LAZY
  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_REFETCH_AFTER_SAVE
  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_DISCARD_AFTER_SAVE
Or a bitwise OR combination of the above:
  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_EAGER | ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_REFETCH_AFTER_SAVE
  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_LAZY | ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_REFETCH_AFTER_SAVE
  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_EAGER | ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_DISCARD_AFTER_SAVE
  • ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_LAZY | ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_DISCARD_AFTER_SAVE

If Fetch Policy is EAGER then an instance of user defined POJO class is always returned and all properties are immediately assigned according to database values. If any of properties refer to other persistent objects such references are followed and corresponding objects are retrieved from the database.

NB: Fetch Policy is EAGER can potentially lead to retrieving very big chunks of data from database and OutOfMemoryError.

If Fetch Policy is LAZY then an instance of a subclass extending user defined POJO class is returned. Its properties are only retrieved on first attempt to access the object.

Fetch Policy is LAZY is not supported for access type FIELDS. However application can call ObjectManager method swizzle() to fetch such properties.

If Fetch policy is FETCH_POLICY_REFETCH_AFTER_SAVE then after any object is saved it is refetched from the database and any changes caused by database triggers, relationships or %OnSave() methods are reflected back in client context. This is the default behaviour. Obviously this value adds some additional overhead on performance.

If Fetch policy is FETCH_POLICY_DISCARD_AFTER_SAVE then after any object is saved it is discarded from client context. POJO values remain unchanged and any proxy objects are discarded. This behaviour improves performance but it can lead to an inconsistency between client and database data. For example inverse values for relationships are not set.

We recommend using FETCH_POLICY_DISCARD_AFTER_SAVE for applications that store massive amounts of data and do not use it after storing. FETCH_POLICY_REFETCH_AFTER_SAVE value is best for applications that operate on data while storing it in the database.

Parameters:
fetchPolicy - Fetch Policy to use
Returns:
Old value of Fetch Policy.
See Also:
ObjectManager.swizzle(Object), ObjectManager.detach(Object), ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_LAZY, ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_EAGER, ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_REFETCH_AFTER_SAVE, ObjectManager.FETCH_POLICY_DISCARD_AFTER_SAVE

getAccessMethod

public abstract int getAccessMethod()
Returns configuration settings that defines how data in POJO is accessed. Jalapeño can use either reflection to access data in POJOs or generate special helper classes. Helper classes are generated runtime and has to be regenerated each time application is restarted. Only Byte Code is generated, not Java source code.

Supported values:

  1. ObjectManager.ACCESS_METHOD_GENERATE_HELPERS
  2. ObjectManager.ACCESS_METHOD_FLEXIBLE
  3. ObjectManager.ACCESS_METHOD_USE_REFLECTION

Returns:
Access Policy used by Jalapeño Engine

setAccessPolicy

public abstract int setAccessPolicy(int accessPolicy)
Sets configuration settings that defines how data in POJO is accessed. Jalapeño can use either reflection to access data in POJOs or generate special helper classes. Helper classes are generated runtime and has to be regenerated each time application is restarted. Only Byte Code is generated, not Java source code.

While generated helpers are usually faster some time is required to generate them.

Supported values:

  1. ObjectManager.ACCESS_METHOD_GENERATE_HELPERS
  2. ObjectManager.ACCESS_METHOD_FLEXIBLE
  3. ObjectManager.ACCESS_METHOD_USE_REFLECTION

If Access Policy is ObjectManager.ACCESS_METHOD_GENERATE_HELPERS then ASM library must be in classpath of the application. It can be downloaded from http://asm.objectweb.org/download/index.html, choose asm-3.1.jar download. If the library is not found exception will be thrown.

If Access Policy is ObjectManager.ACCESS_METHOD_FLEXIBLE then ASM library might be used. If it is not found in classpath a warning message will be printed to System.err and reflection will be used to access data.

Parameters:
accessPolicy - to use
Returns:
Old value of Access Policy.

setAdaptor

public abstract void setAdaptor(Adaptor adaptor)
Add an adaptor to convert data between application and database datatypes. Any number of adaptors may be added using this method. Adaptors can be removed either individually or all together.

Parameters:
adaptor - Adaptor to add
See Also:
removeAdaptor(Adaptor), removeAllAdaptors()

removeAdaptor

public abstract boolean removeAdaptor(Adaptor adaptor)
Removes given adaptor that performs custom data conversion from ObjectManager or Application.

Parameters:
adaptor - Adpator to remove
Returns:
true if adpator is found and removed. If adaptor has not been set then returns false.
See Also:
setAdaptor(Adaptor), removeAllAdaptors()

removeAllAdaptors

public abstract void removeAllAdaptors()
Removes all adaptors that perform custom data conversion, ever set for current ObjectManager or Application

See Also:
removeAdaptor(Adaptor), setAdaptor(Adaptor)
